Authors: Alessio Barili, Charles Wesley Barnes, Maria E Ordonez
Title: New species Hygrocybe rodomaculata
Abstract:
Hygrocybe rodomaculata belongs to the section Coccinae,
considering pink as a discoloration of the characteristic red pileic
surface of the group, with a dry or somewhat viscous stipe (Boccardo et
al. 2008). The closest species based on morphological characters,
according to Boartmann (2008) and Boccardo et al. (2008), is H.
calyptriformis, however, it differs from H. rodomaculata by the pointed
umbo, absence of yellow colour of the stipe and is non-radicate. In
addition, H. calyptriformis belongs to the section Microspore whose
distinctive feature is spore dimensions below 9 µm while H. rodomaculata
exceeds this size. The closest species determined by DNA sequence
analysis was H. reidii, which is distinguished mainly by not having
umbo, by the slightly felted, scaly and uniform coloration, gills more
or less decurrent, a proportionally shorter stipe, slightly smaller
basidiospores, and characteristic honey odour.
